chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean Arron McMahon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= payment to be worked out with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored. No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance, illegal in WI today including THC, without a valid Rx. No entrance into any bars, taverns or liquor store whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. May dine at an establishment that serves alcohol, but may not sit at the bar and anyone sitting at the table may not consume alcohol. May not take Methadone or Suboxone. No alcohol in residence.

Must take any medications prescribed for mental health and/or substance abuse. May take any prescribed medications with advanced agent approval. Mental health assessment and follow through. AODA assessment and follow through. Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Payment of restitution if claim is made. DNA Sample Due: 7-15-2022.

timeConds.notes: 6 months conditional jail time, without good time but with huber if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. Credit for 131 days time served. The sentence credit adjudged has been agreed by the parties and ordered by the court. May serve remainder of sentence in Dickinson County Jail if both jails are in agreement.
